content.question: At time <math alttext="t equals 0" overflow="scroll"><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></math>, a car starts from rest and begins to drive along a straight, horizontal track. The graph shown represents the position of the car as a function of time squared. Which of the following statements correctly describes the motion of the car?

choices.label: The car moves with constant speed, momentarily stops, and then moves again with the same speed.
The car is slowing down at a constant rate, then speeds up but at a slower rate.
The car moves with constant speed.
The car speeds up at a constant rate.

content.answer: The car speeds up at a constant rate.

skill.text: 3.B: Apply an appropriate law, definition, theoretical relationship, or model to make a claim.
